isis.stitle: TSI 92-16-04 - Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

subjectgroup.subject: Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

geninfo.para: This revised TSI replaces the 7000 and 8000 Series information in TSI-90-16-05 dated October, 1990. Discard TSI-90-16-05.

note.para: Two people are needed to complete this installation. Install all bolts that will be visible so that the heads are on the finished side of the deflector and extensions.

geninfo.para: The Air Deflector system for the 8000 Series vehicles consists of the Roof Air Deflector and may be enhanced by Side Air Deflectors at the rear of the cab. A third part of the system is the Sleeper Box Aerodynamic Package which is used in conjunction with the Roof Air Deflector. The Air Deflectors are constructed of fiberglass with metal mountings and reinforcing hardware. The Air Deflector system is normally factory mounted, but does require installation during in-service use preparation.

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION - ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR

warning.para: Do not attempt installation while the muffler and tail pipe are hot. Contact with surfaces can cause serious personal injury. This assembly requires work on the roof of the vehicle or from ladders. Extra care must be taken as falling from this height can cause serious personal injury.

svcproc.para: The Roof Air Deflector has three primary sections: the Air Deflector Shield and the Right and Left Side Air Deflectors. The unit is mounted on the roof of the cab and is shipped in a special stowed position. To prepare the unit for in-service use:

step1.para: Unfasten the shipping braces (Item 3, Figure 1) from the air deflector shield and side air deflectors. Save the screws, nuts, flat washers and lock washers for use in the installation of the air deflector sides to the air deflector shield.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Cab Roof Air Deflector Stored For Shipment

step1.para: Remove the bolts (Item 12, Figure 2) joining the roof channels (Item 10) and the rear air deflector braces (Item 11). Save the bolts, locknuts and brace spacers.
Loosen the bolts (Item 13) joining the rear air deflector braces (Item 11) to the rear air deflector mounting brackets (Item 5).

figure.caption: Figure 2. Cab Roof Air Deflector Detail

calloutgroup.callout1: 16. LOCKNUTS AND WASHERS STRAPPED TO BRACE

step1.para: Loosen the bolts (Items 14 and 15, Figure 3) joining the front air deflector brace (Item 6) to the roof channel (Item 10) and the front air deflector bracket (Item 5)

figure.caption: Figure 3. Air Deflector Channel Attachment (Air Deflector In Raised Position)

calloutgroup.callout1: A. HOLES USED FOR STORING DEFLECTOR

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. To avoid causing damage, minimize body contact with the roof and do not stand on it. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: Remove the upper bolts (Item 12 Figure 4) joining the front air deflector braces (Item 6) to the air deflector mounting plates (Item 7). Mark the bolt holes in each front air deflector brace for future reference. Save the bolts, locknuts and spacers.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Front Deflector Channel Positioning

calloutgroup.callout1: 12 BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
14. BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
15. BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)

step1.para: With help from another person, raise the air deflector shield (Item 2, Figure 5) until the unmarked bolt holes in each front air deflector brace (Item 6) align with the bolt holes in the deflector mounting plates (Item 7). Insert the bolts and spacers (Item 12) saved in step 5 into the aligned bolt holes.
Torque the bolts (Items 14 and 15) at each end of the front air deflector braces (Item 6) to 30 lbs. ft. (46 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 5. Front Channel Attachment

calloutgroup.callout1: 12. BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
14. BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
15. BOLT W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)

step1.para: Align the end holes in the rear air deflector braces (Item 11, Figure 6) with the holes in the roof channels (Item 10) and install the bolts, spacers and locknuts (Items 12, 13, 14 and 15) removed in step 2. Torque the bolts (Items 12 and 13, Figure 6) to 30 lbs. ft. (46 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Air Deflector Channel Attachment (Air Deflector In Raised Position)

calloutgroup.callout1: A. HOLE USED ONLY FOR STOWING DEFLECTOR
B. REAR SIDE DEFLECTOR MOUNTING BRACKET
C. FRONT SIDE DEFLECTOR MOUNTING BRACKET
12. BOLT, W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
13. BOLT, W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
14. BOLT, W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)
15. BOLT, W/SPACER AND LOCKNUT (3/8-16 X 2-3/4 INCH)

step1.para: The locknuts and washers for the forward roof channel mounting studs (Item 3, Figure 7) are not installed at the factory. These locknuts and washers (Item 16, Figure 2and Figure 7) are strapped to a front deflector brace (Item 6, Figure 6). Install and tighten the washers and locknuts.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Roof Channel Mounting Nut Attachment (New 8/91)
Figure 8. Side Deflector Angle Positioning

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. BOLT W/WASHER AND LOCK NUT (5/16-18 X 1.0 INCH)
3. BOLT W/WASHER AND LOCK NUT (5/16-18 X 1.0 INCH)

svcproc.para: The installation of the center section or air deflector shield is now complete and the following steps will describe the installation of the left and right air deflector sides (Item 1, Figure 10). In all steps the left side is the driver side and the right side is the passenger side.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Final Position Of Side Deflector Angle

calloutgroup.callout1: 14. BOLT W/WASHER AND LOCKNUT (5/16-18 X 3/4 INCH)

figure.caption: Figure 10. Side Deflector To Air Deflector Attachment

calloutgroup.callout1: 13. BOLT W/WASHER AND LOCK NUT (5/16-18 X 1.0 INCH)

step1.para: Starting with the left rear air deflector mounting bracket assembly (Item B, Figure 6), loosen the bolt (Item 2, Figure 8) in the slot and remove the bolt (Item 3) from the upper hole in the mounting bracket assembly. Repeat at the left front air deflector mounting bracket (Item C, Figure 6)

Raise the left air deflector side (Item 1, Figure 2, Figure 8 and Figure 9) and align the hole in the rear side deflector mounting bracket (Item 4, Figure 8) with the top of the slot in the side deflector angle (Item 5). Insert the bolt (Item 3) removed in step 2 and torque to 30 lbs. ft. (46 Nm). Repeat at the left front.
Repeat steps 10 and 11 for the right side air deflector side mounting bracket assemblies.

caution.para: Bolts forced into misaligned holes will induce stress in material and can cause extensive material damage. Redrill any set of misaligned holes before inserting a bolt. Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Align the left and right air deflector sides with the air deflector shield making sure the lips of the sides are inside the outer edge of the shield. Using the air deflector shield as a template, check the holes for alignment and with an 11/32 inch bit, redrill any misaligned holes in either air deflector side.

With the help of another person, attach the air deflector sides to the air deflector shield with ten (10) 5/16-18 x 1 inch bolts, flat washers and locknuts, five (5) on each side (Item 13, Figure 10). This includes the four sets removed from the shipping brackets in step 1. Tighten until snug.

note.para: Vehicles built 8/91 and after no longer require the cross braces installed at this point on previous models.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening can cause damage to fiberglass panels.

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION - CAB SIDE AIR DEFLECTORS

warning.para: Do not attempt installation while the muffler and tail pipe are hot. Contact with surfaces can cause serious personal injury. This assembly requires work on the roof of the vehicle or from ladders. Extra care must be taken as falling from this height can cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Remove three sets of bolts, washers and locknuts from each cab side deflector (Item 4, Figure 11) and each upper mounting extender brace (Item 5). Save the bolts, washers and locknuts for use in step 2.

caution.para: Bolts forced into misaligned holes will induce stress in material and can cause extensive material damage. Redrill any set of misaligned holes before inserting a bolt. Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Align the left and right upper cab side air deflectors (Item 3) with the roof air deflector (Items 1 and 2) and the left and right cab side deflectors (Item 4). Temporarily fasten the deflectors together with Visegrip® or similar clamps and install the bolts, washers and locknuts removed in step 1 as shown in Figure 11, Detail A and B. Tighten until snug.

Attach the cab extender-to-air deflector shield braces (Item 6) to the nut plates in the roof air deflector shield as shown in Detail A, Figure 11. Tighten the bolts to 19-27 lbs. ft. (18-21 Nm) at the brace to air deflector shield, then at the brace to the upper cab side air deflector.

svcproc.para: For more information regarding the side air deflectors, refer to the International Service Manual, GROUP 16, CTS-4415 Body Cab, 2000 through 8000.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Roof Air Deflector Extensions

calloutgroup.callout1: 6. CAB EXTENDER TO AIR DEFLECTOR SHIELD BRACE (2 INCH CLEARANCE FROM THE EXHAUST STACK)

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION - SLEEPER ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR

note.para: Two people are needed to complete this installation. Install all bolts that will be visible so that the heads are on the finished side of the deflector and extensions.

svcproc.para: The sleeper box roof air deflector assembly consists of four fiberglass panels, necessary fasteners and bracing. The unassembled pieces are packaged and banded to the vehicle's frame during transportation

note.para: When working on the sleeper box roof, cover it with non-slip protective material to prevent damage to the finish ( Figure 12).

warning.para: Do not attempt installation while the muffler and tail pipe are hot. Contact with surfaces can cause serious personal injury. This assembly requires work on the roof of the vehicle or from ladders. Extra care must be taken as falling from this height can cause serious personal injury.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Proper Use Of Roof Protective Covering (Cabover Illustrated)

important.para: Fasteners used throughout this procedure consist of one capscrew (5/16-18 x 1.0 inch), two flat washers and one locknut. Washers must be in contact with the capscrew head and locknut before tightening.

step1.para: Unpack the roof side air deflector extensions (Item 7, Figure 13), the roof center air deflector extensions (Item 1) and the installation hardware. If required, paint the fairings following instructions in the International Service Manual, GROUP 16, CTS-4361, Paint and Refinishing.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Sleeper Box Air Deflector Detail

caution.para: Bolts forced into misaligned holes will induce stress in material and can cause extensive material damage. Redrill any set of misaligned holes before inserting a bolt. Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: If the fairing braces (Item 9, Figure 14) are not already installed on the roof side air deflector extensions, attach them. Tighten bolts until snug.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Fairing Brace Attachment

caution.para: Do not overtighten the nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to the fiberglass panels.

step1.para: With the aid of another technician and two step ladders, attach the roof side air deflector extensions to the side roof fairing mounting brackets (Item 13, Figure 13) with four capscrews, washers and locknuts.
Attach the extender straps (Item 12, Figure 15) to the roof side air deflector extensions, then connect them to the sleeper side air deflector extensions (Item 16).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Extender Strap Attachment

step1.para: Fit the left and right roof center air deflector extensions (Item 1, Figure 16) together and attach at the center seam flange hole numbers one and five. Count from the front edge of the fairings. Protect the rear edge and outer top surface from damage and, with the help of another technician, support the assembly on its rear edge. This will permit access to the underside of the panels.
Fasten the fairing rear center brackets (Item 15, Figure 16) to the center seam flange at the rear hole. Align the brackets with holes in the roof center air deflector extensions.
Fasten the fairing rear center brackets (Item 3, Figure 16) to the roof center air deflector extensions.
Fasten the center brackets (Item 3) to the center seam flange at hole number 4, counting from the front edge.
Fasten the roof center strap (Item 2) to the center seam flange at holes two and three, counting from the front edge.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Roof Fairing And Center Bracket Attachment

step1.para: With the help from another technician, attach the legs of the lifting sling ( Figure 17) to the four holes at the corners of the roof center air deflector assembly. Lift from the upper side.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Special Lifting Sling Detail

calloutgroup.callout1: 6. 1/4 INCH ROUND X 2 INCH STEEL STOCK

caution.para: Care must be taken to minimize the strain to the roof center air deflector extension center seam flange during positioning. If not handled with care, the assembly will overflex at the flange and damage the assembly.

step1.para: With the aid of another technician, provide support to prevent the roof center air deflector assembly from flexing at the upper seam flange. Raise and guide the assembly into position on the left and right roof side air deflector extensions.

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. Avoid damage by minimizing body contact with the roof. Do not stand on the roof. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: Align each roof center air deflector extension and roof side air deflector extension with a roof fairing support (Item 6, Figure 18). align the rubber flaps (Item 5) between each support and roof center air deflector. Install the required fasteners, leaving the second hole open. Leave the locknuts loose.

caution.para: Slings dangling from a lifting device can snag the air deflector or air deflector extensions while the vehicle is being driven away after the assembly has been completed, and can cause extensive vehicle damage.

note.para: The rubber flaps are not supplied as port of the installation assembly and must be manufactured locally.

step1.para: Align the upper strainer brackets (Item 4, Figure 18) with the second hole in each roof fairing support (Item 6), counting from the front. Leave the locknut loose.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Roof Fairing Support Attachment

step1.para: Align and attach the lower strainer bracket (Item 11, Figure 19) with the first hole in the roof mount (Item 13) counting from the front. Leave the locknut loose.

Align the 45 inch fairing strainer (Item 10, Figure 18) and the upper fairing strainer bracket (Item 4). Tighten the fastener until snug, but do not tighten completely. Now align the strainer with the lower fairing bracket (Item 11, Figure 19). Tighten the fastener until snug, but do not tighten completely. Repeat for the other side.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Fairing Strainer To Roof Mount Attachment

step1.para: Align and attach 61-1/2 inch strainer (Item 14, Figure 20) with the fairing center bracket (Item 3) and roof mount (Item 13, Figure 19) over the front strainer bracket (Item 11, Figure 19). Fasten the strainer to the bracket, but leave the locknut loose.
Attach another 61-1/2 inch strainer (Item 14, Figure 20) to the rear center bracket (Item 15) and the roof mount (Item 13, Figure 19). Leave the locknuts loose.

Tighten the locknuts that attach the strainers (Item 10, Figure 19) to the upper strainer bracket (Item 4, Figure 18) and the lower strainer bracket (Item 11, Figure 19). Tighten to 30 lbs. ft. (46 Nm).
Repeat steps 16 through 18 for the other side.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Fairing Strainer To Center Seam Flange Brackets

step1.para: Attach side roof strap (Item 8, Figure 21) under the roof center air deflector extension and the roof side air deflector extension. Leave the locknuts loose. Repeat on the other side.
With the help of another technician, align the sleeper roof air deflector assembly with the cab roof air deflector assembly. Make sure the gap between the assemblies is even from one end to another.
Tighten the locknuts at the following locations until snug:

item.para: Three (3) at the side roof strap (Item 8, Figure 21).
Five (5) at roof fairing supports (Item 6, Figure 18).
One (1) at the roof center air deflector extension (Item 1, Figure 21) and each roof side air deflector extension.

step1.para: Tighten the locknuts at the following locations to 30 lbs. ft. (46 Nm):

item.para: Two (2) at the 61-1/2 inch fairing strainers (Item 14, Figure 20) and the fairing center brackets (Items 3 and 15) on each side.
One (1) at the lower front strainer bracket (Item 11, Figure 19) and the roof mount (Item 13) on each side.
Two (2) at the 61-1/2 inch fairing strainers (Item 14, Figure 19) and at the roof mount (Item 13) on each side.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Side/Roof Strap Attachment

svcproc.para: For more information regarding the sleeper roof air deflector, refer to the International Service Manual, GROUP 16, CTS-4415 Body Cab, 2000 through 8000.
